intro: Thlaspi multifidum, commonly known as the branched rockcress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other plants with mustard-like flowers. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in spring. Its leaves are lobed and often divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. Thlaspi multifidum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to grow in harsh, arid environments.
